Fantasy Football leap for Alcuin's Reiss

Halifax seconds were the team that everyone thought could crash the Cup party; going into the final week, they will be embroiled in a goal-scoring battle with Vanbrugh and James firsts

BUCS By Numbers

BUCS By Numbers

Ajantha Mendis: Sri Lanka's new spin king

Sports Editor <em>Henry Cowen</em> talks mystery spin with the carrom-bowling enigma that is Ajantha Mendis. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Dhammika Heenpella/Images of Sri Lanka)

Come glide with me

Sports Editor <em>Jake Farrell</em> takes to the skies and goes behind the scenes of the University of York gliding club, discovering a society flourishing thanks to the dedication of its members (Thumbnail credit The facilities and personel at the Pocklington airfield , pictured above, have allowed the gliding club to thrive. Photo: Sarah Morpurgo)

Langwith and Derwent second play out dead rubber as both progress to the Plate

Langwith firsts and Derwent seconds meandered through the final match of Group 2 of the College Cup, with neither side threatening the other's goal.

James thirds top group two as they run out winners against Vanbrugh thirds

In the first game of the day of the final round of fixtures in group two, James thirds completed the shock of the College Cup so far by guaranteeing themselves first place in the group with a 2-1 over Vanbrugh thirds (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Halifax seconds secure second spot with thrashing of Wentworth seconds

A last minute goal from substitute Ben Rea earned Halifax seconds a 5-1 win over Wentworth seconds and, ultimately, secured them a Quarter-Final place at the expense of James firsts by the virtue of goal difference (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

James miss out on Cup qualification despite victory over Vanbrugh fourths

James firsts missed out on qualification for the Quarter-Finals of the College Cup by virtue of goal difference after a their three-goal margin of victory was bettered by Halifax seconds this afternoon (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Vanbrugh secure heavy victory to top Group 1

Vanbrugh firsts responded well to going a goal down early on against Goodricke thirds, eventually running out 7-1 winners to finish top of Group 1

Final day drama in Group 1 sees Halifax seconds through to Quarter-Finals

The final day of Group 1 ended in drama today as Vanbrugh firsts and Halifax seconds sealed their berths in the Quarter-Finals (Thumbnail credit Images: Philippa Grafton)

Can Sir Alex Ferguson crash the Barcelona party?

Luke Gardener previews tonight's Champions League final and asks who will come out on top (Thumbnail credit Image: Dannymx via Flickr Creative Commons)

Dominant James put six past Wentworth

Four first half goals, including wonder strikes for Richard Baxter and Tom Clarke, helped James firsts to an easy win over Wentworth seconds.

College Cup Podcast

By James Bithell

The <em>Nouse</em> Sport team are back to discuss this week's goings-on in the world of the College Cup. Attempting to spend an equal amount of time on every team we preview the final week of the group stage fixtures

Vanbrugh pull off superb performance to keep Cup qualification hopes alive

Vanbrugh beat Halifax seconds thanks to a match winning performance from Ali Prince

Burke hat-trick secures the points for Goodricke as they hammer Vanbrugh fourths

Goodricke thirds secured an easy victory over a Vanbrugh Fourths side that looked bowed by their College Cup campaign courtesy of a hat-trick from Matt Burke

Halifax firsts come from behind to inflict a cruel defeat on James seconds

Halifax firsts maintained their 100% record in this year's College Cup - and confirmed their place in the quarter-finals with a game to spare - with a 2-1 victory over James seconds on a sodden JLD pitch. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Vanbrugh seconds ease to win over Wentworth thirds

Vanbrugh seconds eased to a comfortable 3-0 win over Wentworth thirds to set up a tense finale to Group 4, which could see either Alcuin firsts or Vanbrugh seconds join Halifax firsts in qualifying for the Cup (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Spectacular Alcuin firsts performance proves too much for Derwent thirds

Four goals from Alcuin's Simon Reiss saw his side on their way to a 7-0 hammering of Derwent thirds

Atherton and Brinkworth give Derwent firsts the points

A late Dan Atherton strike ensured Derwent firsts took all three points against Halifax thirds, winning the game 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Wentworth firsts comfortably dismiss the challenge of Alcuin thirds

The numbers of goals conceded by Alcuin thirds increased this afternoon as Wentworth firsts slotted four past the struggling team (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Goodricke seconds take all three points in entertaining match

On a blustery JLD, Goodricke seconds came from behind to beat a resilient Langwith seconds (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Superb comeback by Derwent seconds seals share of the points

Another brace by Jon Garness sealed a brilliant comeback for Derwent seconds as they came from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 with Goodricke firsts (Thumbnail credit Image: Charlie Woods)

James thirds seal plate qualification with another shock win

Another brilliant performance by James thirds earned them a win as they beat Langwith firsts 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Alcuin seconds' bad run continues as they lose out to Vanbrugh thirds

Alcuin seconds' nightmare tournament continued as they went down 3-1 to a talented and hard-working Vanbrugh thirds outfit today (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Charles de Ladoucette remembered as James overcome College Barbarians

College Rugby united today to pay tribute to Charles de Ladoucette, the James player who passed away two years ago. Fittingly, de Ladoucette's college overcame a College Barbarians XV 27-12 in an entertaining game (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

College Cup Podcast

By James Bithell

The second edition of the College Cup podcast is here as the <em>Nouse Sport</em> team run the rule over the previous week's action and have a look what's still to come

The Secret Footballer

By James Bithell

Survival Sunday may shred the nerves and shorten the finger nails but the College Cup can also lay claim to wrench on the emotions of anyone interested in it. When it gets down to the business end of things and the margin for error tightens considerably the JLD becomes an anxious place

Goodricke firsts take their chances against Vanbrugh thirds

The poor conditions on the JLD didn't stop Goodricke firsts from putting four past Vanbrugh's third side allowing them to take the points and go top of their group (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Langwith firsts campaign stutters as they draw a blank against Alcuin seconds

Langwith firsts played Alcuin seconds today in what was a an erratic game of wasted opportunities, that ended without ever really getting up to speed, and concluded at 0-0

Early Clitheroe goal enough to secure an upset for James thirds

James 3rds edged a close encounter over Derwent 2nds this afternoon, with a first-half Sam Clitheroe strike deciding the match in James' favour

Fantasy Football leap for Alcuin's Reiss

Halifax seconds were the team that everyone thought could crash the Cup party; going into the final week, they will be embroiled in a goal-scoring battle with Vanbrugh and James firsts
